The organization designed the experiment last year to assess anxieties among whites over the changing demographics of the country .
The organization designed the experiment last year to assess anxieties among whites over the changing demographics of the country .
Respondents were asked if they agreed or disagreed with the following statement : The idea of an America where most people are not white bothers me .
Thirteen percent said they agreed .

Because of social desirability bias , or the tendency of respondents to give answers that put them in a more positive light , PRRI conducted an experiment where two groups were asked to say how many in a list of three statements bothered them .

Only one of the groups was given a fourth statement that read An America that is not mostly white .
That 13 percent of whites who said they were bothered by the statement when asked directly shoots up to 31 percent when asked indirectly in the list experiment .
